_header: The minister and nourice unto vices
Subjects: pilgrims/pilgrimage; Virgin Mary; Saint Cecilia; Idleness, sin of
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Prologue of the Second Nun’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 119 lines in rhyme royal stanzas.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
The minstre & norice vn to viceswhich that men clepen in
                    englissh Idelnesse…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and brennyng euere in charite ful brightnow haue I declared
                    yow what she hight
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next / bigynneth the seconde nonne hir tale & cetera
                    (f. 215); the seconde nonne (RT); Here endith the Seconde nonne hir
                    Prolog… (f. 216v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
The mynystre and þe Noryse vnto viciswiche þat men clepen
                    in Englisshe ydelnes…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And brennyng euer in Charite ful brightNow haue I ȝow
                    declared what she hight
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here by / gynneþ þe prologe of þe secund nonne
                    (f. 161v); ij nonne (RT); here endith þe prologe… (f.
                    163)

Bod414.First Lines:
[T]He ministre of the norice vnto vicesWhich men clepe in englissh
                    Idilnesse…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…And brennyng euer in charite so lightNow haue I declarid you
                    what she hight
Bod414.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the Prolog of þe secunde Nonne (f.
                    112v)

Bod686.First Lines:
The ministre and þe norice vnto vicesWhich þat men clepe
                    in englissh ydlenesse…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And brennynge euer in cherite ful briȝhtNow have y you
                    declared what she hight
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And here begynneth þe Nonnes tale (f. 176v); Nonne
                    (RT)

                    what sche highte

CULGg427.First Lines:
…And thow men dreddyn neuere for to deyinȝit seen men
                    weel by resoun douteles…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…The storye wrot & folwe hire legendeAnd preye ȝow
                    that ȝe wele myn werk amende…

Holkham667.First Lines:

Holkham667.Last Lines:

Holkham667.Note:
The leaf containing the beginning of the Prologue (comprising ff.
                    2+7 of Quire 4) is inverted, with f. 22 consequently following f. 16. VIII.119
                    (the last line of the Prologue) is the twenty-fifth line of column a,
                    with the remainder of the page and following verso left blank. The Second
                        Nun’s Tale does not occur in this MS.

                    you what se hyght

                    Tales.

                        ed.  
             The Ellesmere Manuscript of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales.
Chaucer Society
         Series 1, nos. 2, 8, 16, 26, 32, 38, 50, 70. London: Trübner,
            1868-79.

BNangl39.First Lines:
The mynystre and norice vnto vicyswhich men in englissh clepith
                    idilnesse…
BNangl39.Last Lines:
…and brennyng euer in charyte ful brightnow haue I yow
                    declarid what she hight
BNangl39.Attributed Title:
…& iam / incipit incipit fabula monialis & cetera (f.
                        77rb)

TokyoTak24.First Lines:
The ministre and norice vnto vicesWich þat men clepen
                    Idelnesse…
TokyoTak24.Last Lines:
…And brenning euer in charite ful briȝtNow haue I you
                    declared what she hiȝt
TokyoTak24.Attributed Title:
…Et incipit fabula Sancte Cecilie prologo / deficiente et per
                        secundam Monialem narrate (f. 213)

TokyoTak32.First Lines:
The ministre of thee noris vnto vyiswhiche that men klepen in
                    Englissche Idlen[damage]…
TokyoTak32.Last Lines:
…I preye yow that yee wollen my werk a mendefferst wolde I yow
                    the name of seynt cecile…

Bodmer48.First Lines:
THe ministre or þe norice vnto viceswhich men clepen in
                    englissh idilnes…
Bodmer48.Last Lines:
…and brennyng euer in charite so lightnow haue I declarid you
                    what she hiȝt
Bodmer48.Attributed Title: The prolog of the secund nonne (f. 129v, rubric)
Bodmer48.Facsimiles:
“Digital
                    Facsimile of Cologny, Fondation Martin Bodmer, Cod. Bodmer 48”
